reviews.sentence: The experience was lovely first time in Paris. The rooms were clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. There was instance where my family had to wait to be seated for breakfast even though the gentleman that worked on 8 Apr acknowledged us. we were left standing until the young lady can not recall the name escorted us to our table. This was the issue and the young lady was very apologetic for this.

The staff was fantastic. The first experience was with Simon and he greeted us quite well. Asked how ourflight and cab drive was and he quickly told us that we paid way to much for the cab. He apologized for the bad experience and gave us free drink tickets. He also took the time to provide insights on the train and how much a cab should be throughout the city.
It was an amazing experience with supberb service.

Not in the center but you will like it. This Bercy area and Bercy village worth a visit. It is beautiful and quiet place. I doubt that you can sleep well if the hotel is not well structured in the downtown and in closer circles to the center you should know first from the map that in which neighborhood you want to accommodate because Paris does not know day and night. Good sleep is important in a trip and you can have it at this Pullman. The room space is fine. The floor and furniture clean. The entrance lobby bar and restaurant is nice and modern. They change the design with flowers for every event happen in the hotel. It was good management. Many Lufthansa crew come and go to this hotel as they might have a contract or something. So it can talk about quality. The design of the reception is different for staff to approach to guests and ask for their needs. Most of the time they do. If you ask for help with an address or something most of the time they help with a map or a print. Although I think for this modern reception desk like this and reply to all the customers without delay they should be trained more in my opinion. We got a room in first floors but despite my assumption it was well quite and nice. In higher floors I believe you can have a good view of seine river as well. The neighborhood is calm and safe. Take a walk in Bercy park and Bercy village if you had time. They are beautiful. The closest hop on hop off station to the hotel which would be at the end of the park near the stadium arena would be approximately 20 minutes to walk. Metro is so close and only 7 8 min. walk. For Metro make sure to get daily passes or more because it is also a good mean to visit sights with no extra charge. If wanted to buy souvenirs check the price first with some other people or shops. I experienced that in Paris you can bargain. even for taxi transportationBreakfast good and complete set. Different breads and fruits. You can hardly find taxi in front of the hotel. Make sure to ask for one before your departure to airport or train station. We had a bad experience and wasted a lot of time. Free Wifi speed is good enough. Bathroom and bathtub clean and modern. Only there were no toothpaste set which I believe they will provide upon request.

Superb hotel made our anniversary special. From the moment we stepped in the door we had a delightful experience. Everything from the staff the food and the room contributed to an exceptional stay to which my spouse and I agreed was one of the best hotel experiences we have had. When we arrived having booked the wrong type of room for a family with a young child they realised without asking and moved us to the right type of room for our family. They also provided a gift when we told them it was our anniversary. The interior design of the hotel is lovely with a pleasant feeling of space throughout. The rooms are well equipped with excellent facilities. My spouse particularly liked the raining shower which rained water from the ceiling.
The experience in your hotel met my axpectations.

Cosy modern hotel in a quieter part of Paris. A great area to stay away from all the madness with easy access to the centre of town. Experience the locals Paris rather than tourists Paris. Great hotel experience all round.

Chic weekend in Paris. Superb hotel modern design comfortable bedrooms and amazing breakfast. Very attentive staff. Parking is a bit of a rip off though. Location wise it is away from the centre and the tourist trail but great vibe and atmosphere at Cour St Emilion.

First time at Pullman Bercy because my usual Novotel Gare de Lyon was fully booked. Very impressed by the overall experience especially as I was lucky to receive an upgrade to an amazing Junior suite and enjoy as well the Thursday evening bar atmosphere with complimentary shoe shine massage and DJ which are appreciated when travelling alone on business. The staff welcoming attitude professionalism and friendliness were also remarkable. Thank you.

A good experience. Overall good experience it is nice to have a refreshment at the welcome desk and some fruits. The sharing box is nice to enjoy a fun moment with people I was travelling with. The breakfast is great. Food at the bar is nice. Negative point I requested as soon as I checked in a very quiet room and was given a very noisy one facing the road. I had to change during my stay because I could not sleep properly. But it has been difficult to change I had to insist a lot.

Mixed Experience. There is much going for this facility including proximity to Bercy Village and the Metro and some tasteful updating. However these assets are at odds with several negatives including uneven experience with hotel and restaurant staff — some try very hard others do not — and ongoing renovations on the main floor that make for a truly confusing arrival and disrupted traffic patterns. Referring to this as a ” luxury ” hotel seems quite a bit of a stretch as it is lacking in attention to finer detail and top flight service. OK experience but not one we are likely to repeat.

Comfortable and convenient. I have stayed at Pullman Bercy before. Coming back was a great experience. Reliable and convenient guest service. This time I had my colleagues from work with me who liked the hotel and its amenities.
Proximity to Arena made it an ideal location to stay. Experience was fine except for the refurbishment that was ongoing.

Hotel was clean new appearance and completely satisfactory. Lobby and bar were great room was good and as expected. Breakfast experience was average not great. did not provide alternative milks such as almond or oat. Pool was amazing and new. fitness center was very bad and not on par with the pool or spa amenities.

two nigths trip to Paris. Main reason for our stay was to watch a show in the nearby Acor Arena … I write this article as a Platinum member. Arrival into Paris with our private car was fine. Parking at the hotel is very difficult even just for check in. Only two check in counters were available with a view people waiting. When it was my turn I presented my booking details as well as my platinum membership card. No greetings as a loyal member was given as well as no upgrade. Even for the welcome drink vouchers I had to ask at the end of check in. So the check in experiences compared with other Pullman hotels was not so good. Our room was a family room with two big beds. Nice and clean perfect for our stay. I made my self a cup of tea before we left for the show. After we came back we discovered that the water kettle was spoilt and water was leaking all over the area. Spilling water on some of my documents and my mobile phone luckily the phone was still working. The kettle was exchanged after we complained to the front desk but when we returned to the room after dinner the next problem happened. Our room was without power. So I had to go back to the front desk to ask for help again. We had to wait for 15 minutes till somebody came up to the room just to check on some fuses which caused the problem with the power fail. Next morning we went for breakfast around 0930 hopping to avoid the big Chinese ’s travel groups but unfortunately they were still there. So we had to wait for a table and it was very load. Once we had a table we discovered that a lot of breakfast stuff was not available. For example the complete tea section was out of stock glasses were missing at the juice section and lots of food was not available. So the breakfast experience was not very pleasant and we were looking forward to it because we read that Pullman has one of the best breakfasts in town. After my breakfast I wanted to collect my tickets for a river cruise on the Sein which I was included in my room package. Unfortunately the tickets were not ready yet and I was ask to wait another 30 minutes before the responsible person would arrive. Of course I do n’t wanted to wait again so we left without the tickets and bought them latter on directly at the cruise company. At check out we were reimbursed for the tickets and the room rate was reduced as well for one night to compensate the price different. This was nice of the hotel but still I ca n’t believe a 4 star hotel ca n’t even handle a sim.

Check in and check out time was very difficult for our clients. The check in time was delayed and client were very tired reception stuff was not handling it well asking for money from clients who were prepaid by MCI they were part of the group and they were told that they will need to pay in order to be checked in at 20 pm. I am sure that this is to bad management and instructions to the reception and it affected overall our clients experience. MCI was not aware of any late check in. The line was very bad we could not communicate with the front desk overall experience in check in time was really bad. I am dealing with high end clients on daily bases and never had so much hassle with 9 rooms to check in. In check out time there was another problem. Once of our clients who was checking out was asked to pay for dinner rooms service which was already paid in one invoice. I have been calling during the check in time to the reception but again they could not hear me properly so they did not want to speak I called the events department they were as well saying that this was not paid. I received confirmation from events team that everybody is well informed about all. When I asked for this particular dinner voucher she informed that there is not problem. But in check out time there was and our client was charged. I am waiting at the moment for confirmation for receiving money back from your hotel for the dinner.

Okay experience. It was okay experience nothing was done to make me feel like an Acor gold member. No room upgrades nor extra length to make my stay comfortable.

Very Good. Great hotel great location staff very helpful and friendly. Second time of staying Hotel was very busy breakfast unfortunately was not has we had previously experienced. Choice not as great and had to wait for food to be replenished on both mornings.

Great service bar. In the bar at the Pullman is always a good atmosphere and great service. This evening I was served by Sandep who was very friendly and thoughtful. Even learned new French. As a regular guest the staff does great effort to remember you by name which adds to the experience.

Short family break for food show. We chose the Pullman as we always try to stay in the groups hotels but sadly this experience was far from the usual standard. Evening meal was average at best. Over priced even for Paris poorly cooked and terrible service. Lobby is poorly laid out staff hard to find. Breakfast was good but not a patch on London Pullman. Room very clean and staff very professional. Local area is quiet with lovely little “ village ” of shops and restaurants. Easy access to tube.
